title: Real-time data exploitation supported by model- and event-driven architecture to enhance situation awareness, application to crisis management
analysis_techniques: Document analysis; Complex event processing; Descriptive analysis
research_description: The paper proposes a framework that merges model-driven and event-driven architectures for real-time data exploitation to improve situation awareness, focusing on crisis management scenarios.
research_results: The proposed architecture is validated through a realistic flood scenario, demonstrating improvements in real-time data processing and decision support for crisis management.
future_research: Future work should explore the integration of additional data sources and further refinement of the framework for broader applications in public sector crisis management.
